title: KecIsHere2
author: KecIsHere2
content: I try to find some apps for indicators. To alert me when indicators for some coin reach some value but I could not find any apps for that so I am trying to create one.Here is the app: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.kec.crypto.alert.indicatorI just start working on it there are tons of stuff that needs to be added so every suggestion is welcome.For now, I just add RSI and MACD signals(that are the main signals that I am using for trading) and maybe MACD can be updated to work in multiple ways. If anyone has some suggestions I am open I am thinking to add a third signal but not sure which one. Thinking about Bollinger bands.So what do you think?

If anyone has some suggestions I am open I am thinking to add a third signal but not sure which one. Thinking about Bollinger bands.So what do you think?Tradingview has this kind of feature if you click the alarm clock icon but only limited to the indicator that you are using on your chart. You can only use 3 indicator for non pro member so it means you have only limited choices for an alert. I like your idea because we can use multiple indicator at the same time without getting a subscription on tradingview. I’m still not opening due to my current device but BB and EMA lines is what commonly use of traders for their signal. This is a good addition to your app. How many indicator can you input on your ap that can work at the same time to give a signal?

Also, I could create the EMA but in what way? If the price hit EMA line to alert the users? Is that enough?You can only set an alert on indicator that you are using on your actual chart. You can’t see all the indicators on the alert except if it’s being use by you. Yes hitting the EMA line sufficient but if you can do an alert when EMA lines cross to each other then it will be better. Use only popular indicator for your indicator like Bollinger, MACD, RSI and EMA to make it simple. Btw does the app will be available soon on for IOS or are you just prioritizing android for this app development? Kudos on your hard work. I will give a feedback once I use it this weekends after I get my fund for trading. This is the best for swing trades!

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: If you want to use an app with many indicators, you can use TabTrader. I have used that app for years and do not have any problems. The app has so many indicators but I only used the basic indicators, which helped me analyze the market movements.But you should learn about how to use the basic indicators so you can use it properly. I am not using any other app indicators like other member's suggestions because it is enough to use that app.

All platforms offer tradingview integration while trading, so you don't need a third party application.I do not advise you to download such applications because it may lead to the loss of your money because many fraudsters design fake applications.The famous and basic indicators are present in tradingview, after which you can develop your strategic plan.The purpose of the is a notification for a certain signal set on a specific indicator. Trading offers limited use of indicator up to 3 for those free member. The indicator is not the main subject on this app but rather the alert notification feature that is vital for momentum trading. The idea of OP is to collect all the useful indicators and allow user to set alert notification on all of this indicator at the same time which trading view and other app doesn’t support since most of them only focus on price alert not on the indicator signal itself.The safety of the app is one of my concern which is why I still don’t download and use the app. Does playstore doesn’t review the app before they list? Is it possible for an app in playstore still contain malware to hack phone?
